criteria: Provider credentialing process includes verification of current license
description: Document must demonstrate that the credentialing process includes verification of current state license, DEA registration, and board certification status. The process should include primary source verification and be completed within 180 days of application.
compliance_requirements: Primary source verification of current license

criteria: Credentialing process includes verification of education and training
description: The credentialing process must include verification of education and training credentials from primary sources. This includes medical school graduation, residency completion, and fellowship training if applicable.
compliance_requirements: Primary source verification of medical education

criteria: Recredentialing process conducted at least every 36 months
description: The organization must conduct recredentialing of all providers at least every 36 months. The process should include verification of continued qualifications and performance evaluation.

criteria: Clear statement of member rights and responsibilities
description: The organization must provide clear, written information about member rights and responsibilities. This should include grievance and appeal procedures, confidentiality protections, and access to care requirements.
The organization must clearly communicate member responsibilities including providing accurate information, following treatment plans, and understanding benefit limitations.

criteria: Utilization management program with written criteria
description: The organization must have a utilization management program with written clinical criteria for decision-making. The program should include pre-service, concurrent, and post-service review processes.

criteria: Utilization management decisions made by qualified clinical personnel
description: All utilization management decisions must be made by qualified clinical personnel with appropriate training and experience in the relevant clinical area.
The organization must have a comprehensive quality management program that includes quality assessment, improvement activities, and performance measurement across all aspects of care delivery.

criteria: Performance measurement using HEDIS or equivalent measures
description: The organization must conduct performance measurement using HEDIS measures or equivalent standardized measures to assess quality of care and service delivery.

criteria: Care management program for high-risk populations
description: The organization must have a care management program that identifies and manages high-risk populations, including those with chronic conditions, complex care needs, or multiple comorbidities.

criteria: Care coordination across providers and settings
description: The organization must ensure care coordination across multiple providers and care settings, including transitions of care and communication between providers.

criteria: Adequate provider network to meet member needs
description: The organization must maintain an adequate provider network that meets member access needs, including appropriate geographic distribution and specialty coverage.

criteria: Ongoing monitoring of provider network performance
description: The organization must conduct ongoing monitoring of provider network performance, including quality indicators, access measures, and member satisfaction.

criteria: Clinical practice guidelines based on evidence-based medicine
description: The organization must develop and maintain clinical practice guidelines that are based on evidence-based medicine and current clinical standards.

criteria: Systematic implementation of clinical practice guidelines
description: The organization must have a systematic approach to implementing clinical practice guidelines, including provider education, monitoring, and feedback mechanisms.
